intro: Thesium linophyllon var. pratense, commonly known as the meadow thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is a low-growing perennial with erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows.
